comment.author: 92284803@N00
comment._content: It looks like considerable retouching has been done on this photo -- most of the outlines seem to have been drawn over.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philip_Chetwode,_1st_Baron_Chetwode See digitalgallery.nypl.org/nypldigital/id?830973 which is a book illustration according to NYPL's description. I think I see "from the painting..." at bottom right. And www.heritage-images.com/Preview/PreviewPage.aspx?id=16479... which indicates that the artist is John Saint-Helier Lander

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: He was painted again by Lander in 1919. www.bbc.co.uk/arts/yourpaintings/paintings/general-sir-ph... is a painting in the collections of the Imperial War Museum. And the cartoonist Spy had captured him in 1910 commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Philip_Chetwode_Vanity_Fa...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: From www.firstworldwar.com/bio/chetwode.htm "With the arrival of the First World War in August 1914 Chetwode, a Brigadier General, was assigned command of 5th Cavalry Brigade in France and Belgium during 1914-15."
